dreisoft.tresos.generator.ng.api.cds.ctypes
Class PrimitiveTypeFactory

java.lang.Object
  dreisoft.tresos.generator.ng.api.cds.ctypes.PrimitiveTypeFactory

public class PrimitiveTypeFactory
extends java.lang.Object

A factory class for PrimitiveType objects.

This class provides functionality to map classes of PrimitiveType to arbitrary identifier strings and to create instances of these classes using the identifiers. This can be helpful if you're using PrimitiveType classes with the same name from different packages extending different superclasses, e.g. class xyz.uint16.MyInt that extends the UInt16 class and another xyz.uint32.MyInt that extends the UInt32 class.

Example: 

 PrimitiveTypeFactory factory = new PrimitiveTypeFactory();
 
 if( is16BitArch ) {
     factory.setType( "myInt", xyz.uint16.MyInt.class );
 } else {
     factory.setType( "myInt", xyz.uint32.MyInt.class );
 }
 
 PrimitiveType someInt = factory.create( "myInt", "varA", 10 );

Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

Since:
2008.b

Constructor Detail

PrimitiveTypeFactory

public PrimitiveTypeFactory()
Method Detail

setType

public void setType(java.lang.String identifier,
                    java.lang.Class<? extends PrimitiveType> type)
Maps the given PrimitiveType class to the given identifier string. If another class is already associated with the same identifier then it will be overwritten with the new class.

Parameters:
identifier - An arbitrary unique string that identifies the given PrimitiveType class, never null.
type - The PrimitiveType class that is associated with the given identifier string, never null.
Since:
2008.b

getType

public java.lang.Class<? extends PrimitiveType> getType(java.lang.String identifier)
Returns the PrimitiveType class that was associated with the given identifier using method setType(String, Class) before. If there is no class associated with the given identifier string then null will be returned.

Parameters:
identifier - The identifier associated with the requested class.
Returns:
The PrimitiveType class for the given identifier or null.
Since:
2008.b

hasType

public boolean hasType(java.lang.String identifier)
Determines whether a PrimitiveType class was associated with the given identifier.

Parameters:
identifier - The identifier to check.
Returns:
true if a PrimitiveType class is associated with the given identifier, false otherwise.
Since:
2008.b

create

public PrimitiveType create(java.lang.String identifier,
                            long value)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                            java.lang.NoSuchMethodException,
                            java.lang.InstantiationException,
                            java.lang.IllegalAccessException,
                            java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException
Creates a new instance of the PrimitiveType class associated with the given identifier. The new primitive type will be initialized with the given value.

Parameters:
identifier - The identifier associated with the requested PrimitiveType class, never null.
value - The value of the new primitive type object.
Returns:
A new instance of the requested PrimitiveType class identified by the given identifier and initialized with the given value.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If one of the arguments has an invalid value or there is no class associated with the given identifier.
java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - If the PrimitiveType class does not provide the expected constructor.
java.lang.InstantiationException - If the PrimitiveType class can not be instantiated (e.g. is abstract).
java.lang.IllegalAccessException - If the PrimitiveType class or its constructor is not accessible.
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException - If the constructor throws an exception.
Since:
2008.b

identifier - The identifier associated with the requested PrimitiveType class, never null.
name - The name of the new primitive type object, never null.
value - The value of the new primitive type object.
Returns:
A new instance of the requested PrimitiveType class identified by the given identifier and initialized with the given name and value.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If one of the arguments has an invalid value or there is no class associated with the given identifier.
java.lang.NoSuchMethodException - If the PrimitiveType class does not provide the expected constructor.
java.lang.InstantiationException - If the PrimitiveType class can not be instantiated (e.g. is abstract).
